oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Police Department Youth Baseball Team, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1957, Vol. 5 p. 1
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Mayor Ben West and the Chief of Police Douglas E. Hosse with the Police Department's youth baseball team. The team was an entry into the Babe Ruth League of Nashville in 1957, where it won the Western Division Championship. Taken by James (Hot) Dorris. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1957. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
